page.title: 02Living on a St. Levan Farm.
page.content: Potato Harvesting. by Mark Williams. (Roskestal) One morning we started potatoes. I helped on the harvester, it was a bit windy and dusty. We did have a cover on it but it broke and I got sore eyes in the morning. Then we loaded three trailers and we had to load them on the ground. My grandpa drove the tractor and my dad picks up the sacks of potatoes. I pick up the rotten potatoes from the machine. The workmen help. We got a new tractor for pulling the harvester. At midday we went in for dinner, we had sandwiches and salad and then we started again. I didn't go because my dad said I didn't have to. Later I went down on my bike to see them with my sister. When we got down to the field there was no tractor. They were digging in another field.
